messages.title: Securing a better future for Northampton North
messages.content: We've come a long way since 2010 and the economic mess inherited from Labour. But the job is not done. Now with a growing economy, more jobs, lower taxes and a better NHS we can finally provide the better future for our loved ones.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plan for more jobs, lower taxes, and better infrastructure including a new bridge, better flood defenses, faster broadband, improved roads, and a second railway station.
Supports the best way to support the next generation through education. Wants to improve local schools by meeting pupils and teachers and to ensure they have the attention they need.
Continued improvements to NHS services, backing plans for new affordable homes while only offering the best support services and continuing to upgrade local hospitals and transport links to cope.
Plans to support policing efforts to cut bureaucracy and put more Police back on the streets.
Help local families through various initiatives including tax cuts over £6,000, supporting efforts to put more Police back on the streets and ensuring affordable homes.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only need to win 23 more votes to be able and guarantee Ed Miliband does not become Prime Minister... A vote could be the difference.

issues.economy: Plans for more jobs, lower taxes, and better local infrastructure.
issues.education: Supports the best way to support the next generation through education.
issues.health: Continued improvements to NHS services and upgrade local hospitals.
issues.socialWelfare: Supports plans for new affordable homes to help local families.

housing.content: Plans to support new affordable homes to help local families.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Northampton North
politicalExperience.achievements: Supported Northampton's great new railway station; backed plans for new affordable homes; huge annual Job Fairs helping hundreds of local people; involvement in local hospital and school to meet pupils and teachers.

images.caption: Michael supported Northampton's great new railway station.
Michael and his team out talking to residents about his plan for Northampton North.
Michael with Prime Minister David Cameron at the House of Commons.
The best way to support the next generation is through education.
Michael is backing plans for new affordable homes.
Michael has supported tax cuts for over 36,000 hardworking people in Northampton North.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Your local vote delivers Conservatives achievements which includes the deficit down, income tax cut, more jobs and new businesses as compared to coalition of chaos.
